vague_description: A student needs to determine the optimal number of calcium and vitamin D pills to take each month in order to ensure effective absorption while minimizing the overall time required for efficacy.
detailed_description: A student takes calcium pills and vitamin D pills one after the other. Each calcium pill takes \param{Tc} minutes to be effective while each vitamin D pill takes \param{Td} minutes to be effective. Over a month, the student must take at least \param{Pmin} pills of medication and at least \param{Dmin} should be vitamin D pills because they enhance the absorption of calcium in the body. Since vitamin D is complimentary to calcium, the student must take more calcium pills than vitamin D pills. How many pills of each should the student take to minimize the total time it takes for the medication to be effective?
target_objective: Minimize the total effectiveness time for all medication taken over a month
target_constraints: Number of calcium pills is non-negative
Number of vitamin D pills is non-negative
Total number of pills taken must be at least Pmin
Number of vitamin D pills taken must be at least Dmin
Number of calcium pills must be greater than the number of vitamin D pills
target_parameters: Effective time for each calcium pill
Effective time for each vitamin D pill
Minimum total number of pills to be taken in a month
Minimum number of vitamin D pills to be taken in a month
